member.name: INamespaceWalkCB.EnterFolder
member.summary: Called when a folder is about to be entered during a namespace walk. Use this method for any initialization of the retrieved item.
member.param: A pointer to an object representing the parent of the folder designated by pidl.
The PIDL, relative to psf, of the folder being entered.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: INamespaceWalkCB.FoundItem
member.summary: Called when an object is found in the namespace during a namespace walk. Use this method as the main action function for the class implementing it. Perform your actions as needed inside this method.
member.param: A pointer to an object representing the folder containing the item.
The item's PIDL, relative to psf.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: INamespaceWalkCB.InitializeProgressDialog
member.summary: Initializes the window title and cancel button text of the progress dialog box displayed during the namespace walk.
member.param: When this method returns, contains a pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the title to be used for the dialog box.
When this method returns, contains a pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the text displayed on the button that cancels the namespace walk.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: INamespaceWalkCB.LeaveFolder
member.summary: Called after a namespace walk through a folder. Use this method to perform any necessary cleanup following the actions performed by or .
member.param: A pointer to an object representing the parent of the folder designated by pidl.
A PIDL, relative to psf, of the folder being exited.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: INamespaceWalkCB
member.summary: A callback interface exposing methods used with . After performing a walk with INamespaceWalk, an object representing the walked nodes is passed to the INamespaceWalkCB methods. What those methods do with the information depends on the object that is implementing them.
